content.description: Solid line up good rock. Its simplicity and lack of cheat holds make it a fun, albeit short, problem
content.location: Sit start in a small cave/ depression. Starting hold is a small left hand ledge with a 2 finger right hand ledge sitting on inch below it. Long move to incut pocket/crimp. Find good blind hold and move to the top with secure feet and nice finishing holds. This standalone boulder, "The Girl Scout Boulder", hosts a few short, easy boulders.

content.description: Hard Sit-start move to a great sidepull ledge.
content.location: Starts on the climbers right side of the boulder. Sit start on the rounded, slightly bulging section with bad feet and an incut sidepull. Move to the various big ledges on the right and top out.
Start with the incut pocket/crimp. Move to good blind hold around the bend. Good feet and hands to the top.

content.description: This is the first set of boulders/cliff outcrops starting at the 2nd parking lot of the North Ridge Trail. Limited development potential in this location, but a worthy of a last minute visit as it is so close to the trail head.
